description: Korean boxwood (Buxus sinica var. insularis 'Tide Hill') is an amazing shrub, perfect for providing year round structure in the garden. It is tough, drought tolerant, and extremely hardy, thriving in diverse climates from full sun to full shade. Dark green foliage provides an evergreen backdrop and its dense, upright habit can be easily clipped and shaped. Its small size and slow growth rate makes it a perfect selection for urban and patio gardens. Plus, it requires minimal maintenance, making it a hassle-free addition to any landscape. With just a bit of extra care, it can be a stunning centerpiece for many years to come.
